titleStmt.title: A dialogue betwixt two Protestants in answer to a popish catechism called A short catechism against all sectaries : plainly shewing that the members of the Church of England are no sectaries but true Catholicks and that our Church is a found part of Christ's holy Catholick Church in whose communion therefore the people of this nation are most strictly bound in conscience to remain : in two parts.
titleStmt.author: Rawlet, John, 1642-1686.

titleStmt.title: A dialogue betwixt two Protestants in answer to a popish catechism called A short catechism against all sectaries : plainly shewing that the members of the Church of England are no sectaries but true Catholicks and that our Church is a found part of Christ's holy Catholick Church in whose communion therefore the people of this nation are most strictly bound in conscience to remain : in two parts.
titleStmt.author: Rawlet, John, 1642-1686.

notesStmt.note: Written by John Rawlet. Cf. DNB.
Caption title: A dialogue betwixt a teacher and a learner.
Reproduction of original in Bodleian Library.
